Klaus Schwab said he doesn't think it will. "I'm absolutely sure that the euro will not collapse because I think there is still a strong European solidarity in place," he told AP. Europe, in this new world that is coming up, if it wants to become a key actor and stay a key actor it has to express itself in terms of its unity and it has to make sure that euro is also secured by a much greater common effort, working together in fiscal monetary and general economic policies.
